pokemon.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.
pokemon.name: Bulbasaur

pokemon.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
pokemon.name: Ivysaur

pokemon.description: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
pokemon.name: Venusaur

pokemon.description: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
pokemon.name: Charmander

pokemon.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
pokemon.name: Charmeleon

pokemon.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.
pokemon.name: Charizard

pokemon.description: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
pokemon.name: Squirtle

pokemon.description: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
pokemon.name: Wartortle

pokemon.description: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
pokemon.name: Blastoise

pokemon.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
pokemon.name: Caterpie

pokemon.description: This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
pokemon.name: Metapod

pokemon.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
pokemon.name: Butterfree

pokemon.description: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.
pokemon.name: Weedle

pokemon.description: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.
pokemon.name: Kakuna

pokemon.description: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
pokemon.name: Beedrill

pokemon.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
pokemon.name: Pidgey

pokemon.description: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.
pokemon.name: Pidgeotto

pokemon.description: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.
pokemon.name: Pidgeot

pokemon.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.
pokemon.name: Rattata

pokemon.description: It uses its whis­ kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.
pokemon.name: Raticate

pokemon.description: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
pokemon.name: Spearow

pokemon.description: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.
pokemon.name: Fearow

pokemon.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.
pokemon.name: Ekans

pokemon.description: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
pokemon.name: Arbok

pokemon.description: When several of these POKéMON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.
pokemon.name: Pikachu

pokemon.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.
pokemon.name: Raichu

pokemon.description: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.
pokemon.name: Sandshrew

pokemon.description: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
pokemon.name: Sandslash

pokemon.description: Although small, its venomous barbs render this POKéMON dangerous. The female has smaller horns.
pokemon.name: Nidoran-f

pokemon.description: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
pokemon.name: Nidorina

pokemon.description: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.
pokemon.name: Nidoqueen

pokemon.description: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.
pokemon.name: Nidoran-m

pokemon.description: An aggressive POKéMON that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
pokemon.name: Nidorino

pokemon.description: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones.
pokemon.name: Nidoking

pokemon.description: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.
pokemon.name: Clefairy

pokemon.description: A timid fairy POKéMON that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.
pokemon.name: Clefable

pokemon.description: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
pokemon.name: Vulpix

pokemon.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.
pokemon.name: Ninetales

pokemon.description: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
pokemon.name: Jigglypuff

pokemon.description: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
pokemon.name: Wigglytuff

pokemon.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
pokemon.name: Zubat

pokemon.description: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
pokemon.name: Golbat

pokemon.description: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
pokemon.name: Oddish

pokemon.description: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
pokemon.name: Gloom

pokemon.description: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
pokemon.name: Vileplume

pokemon.description: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw­ ing nutrients from the bug host.
pokemon.name: Paras

pokemon.description: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
pokemon.name: Parasect

pokemon.description: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.
pokemon.name: Venonat

pokemon.description: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
pokemon.name: Venomoth

pokemon.description: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.
pokemon.name: Diglett

pokemon.description: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
pokemon.name: Dugtrio

pokemon.description: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
pokemon.name: Meowth

pokemon.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
pokemon.name: Persian

pokemon.description: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.
pokemon.name: Psyduck

pokemon.description: Often seen swim­ ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
pokemon.name: Golduck

pokemon.description: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
pokemon.name: Mankey

pokemon.description: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
pokemon.name: Primeape

pokemon.description: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.
pokemon.name: Growlithe

pokemon.description: A POKéMON that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
pokemon.name: Arcanine

pokemon.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.
pokemon.name: Poliwag

pokemon.description: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.
pokemon.name: Poliwhirl

pokemon.description: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
pokemon.name: Poliwrath

pokemon.description: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.
pokemon.name: Abra

pokemon.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.
pokemon.name: Kadabra

pokemon.description: Its brain can out­ perform a super­ computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
pokemon.name: Alakazam

pokemon.description: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
pokemon.name: Machop

pokemon.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokemon.name: Machoke

pokemon.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
pokemon.name: Machamp

pokemon.description: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
pokemon.name: Bellsprout

pokemon.description: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.
pokemon.name: Weepinbell

pokemon.description: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
pokemon.name: Victreebel

pokemon.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
pokemon.name: Tentacool

pokemon.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
pokemon.name: Tentacruel

pokemon.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
pokemon.name: Geodude

pokemon.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
pokemon.name: Graveler

pokemon.description: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
pokemon.name: Golem

pokemon.description: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.
pokemon.name: Ponyta

pokemon.description: Very competitive, this POKéMON will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
pokemon.name: Rapidash

pokemon.description: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
pokemon.name: Slowpoke

pokemon.description: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.
pokemon.name: Slowbro

pokemon.description: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.
pokemon.name: Magnemite

pokemon.description: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
pokemon.name: Magneton

pokemon.description: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.
pokemon.name: Farfetchd

pokemon.description: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
pokemon.name: Doduo

pokemon.description: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
pokemon.name: Dodrio

pokemon.description: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
pokemon.name: Seel

pokemon.description: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
pokemon.name: Dewgong

pokemon.description: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
pokemon.name: Grimer

pokemon.description: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
pokemon.name: Muk

pokemon.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
pokemon.name: Shellder

pokemon.description: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
pokemon.name: Cloyster

pokemon.description: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
pokemon.name: Gastly

pokemon.description: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an­ other dimension.
pokemon.name: Haunter

pokemon.description: Under a full moon, this POKéMON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
pokemon.name: Gengar

pokemon.description: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
pokemon.name: Onix

pokemon.description: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
pokemon.name: Drowzee

pokemon.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.
pokemon.name: Hypno

pokemon.description: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
pokemon.name: Krabby

pokemon.description: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
pokemon.name: Kingler

pokemon.description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL, they have zapped many people.
pokemon.name: Voltorb

pokemon.description: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.
pokemon.name: Electrode

pokemon.description: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
pokemon.name: Exeggcute

pokemon.description: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE.
pokemon.name: Exeggutor

pokemon.description: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON's real face.
pokemon.name: Cubone

pokemon.description: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
pokemon.name: Marowak

pokemon.description: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
pokemon.name: Hitmonlee

pokemon.description: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.
pokemon.name: Hitmonchan

pokemon.description: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
pokemon.name: Lickitung

pokemon.description: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
pokemon.name: Koffing

pokemon.description: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years.
pokemon.name: Weezing

pokemon.description: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
pokemon.name: Rhyhorn

pokemon.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.
pokemon.name: Rhydon

pokemon.description: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.
pokemon.name: Chansey

pokemon.description: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea­ weed. Its vines shake as it walks.
pokemon.name: Tangela

pokemon.description: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.
pokemon.name: Kangaskhan

pokemon.description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokemon.name: Horsea

pokemon.description: Capable of swim­ ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokemon.name: Seadra

pokemon.description: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.
pokemon.name: Goldeen

pokemon.description: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming power­ fully up rivers and creeks.
pokemon.name: Seaking

pokemon.description: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
pokemon.name: Staryu

pokemon.description: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokemon.name: Starmie

pokemon.description: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.
pokemon.name: Mr-mime

pokemon.description: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
pokemon.name: Scyther

pokemon.description: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokemon.name: Jynx

pokemon.description: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
pokemon.name: Electabuzz

pokemon.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
pokemon.name: Magmar

pokemon.description: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.
pokemon.name: Pinsir

pokemon.description: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
pokemon.name: Tauros

pokemon.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokemon.name: Magikarp

pokemon.description: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
pokemon.name: Gyarados

pokemon.description: A POKéMON that has been over­ hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.
pokemon.name: Lapras

pokemon.description: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
pokemon.name: Ditto

pokemon.description: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs.
pokemon.name: Eevee

pokemon.description: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.
pokemon.name: Vaporeon

pokemon.description: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts.
pokemon.name: Jolteon

pokemon.description: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.
pokemon.name: Flareon

pokemon.description: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
pokemon.name: Porygon

pokemon.description: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
pokemon.name: Omanyte

pokemon.description: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.
pokemon.name: Omastar

pokemon.description: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.
pokemon.name: Kabuto

pokemon.description: Its sleek shape is perfect for swim­ ming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.
pokemon.name: Kabutops

pokemon.description: A ferocious, pre­ historic POKéMON that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.
pokemon.name: Aerodactyl

pokemon.description: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
pokemon.name: Snorlax

pokemon.description: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
pokemon.name: Articuno

pokemon.description: A legendary bird POKéMON that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.
pokemon.name: Zapdos

pokemon.description: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.
pokemon.name: Moltres

pokemon.description: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.
pokemon.name: Dratini

pokemon.description: A mystical POKéMON that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.
pokemon.name: Dragonair

pokemon.description: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
pokemon.name: Dragonite

pokemon.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.
pokemon.name: Mewtwo

pokemon.description: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
pokemon.name: Mew
